title: Solar System
summary: The Solar System is the gravitationally bound system of the Sun and the objects that orbit it, including eight planets and their natural satellites.

data.Location: Local Interstellar Cloud, Local Bubble, Orion Arm, Milky Way

content.text: The Solar System is the gravitationally bound system of the Sun and the objects that orbit it. It formed 4.6 billion years ago from the gravitational collapse of a giant interstellar molecular cloud. The vast majority of the system's mass is in the Sun, with most of the remaining mass contained in the planet Jupiter.

The Solar System consists of the Sun and its planetary system of eight planets, their moons, and other non-stellar objects. The four smaller inner planets, Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars, are terrestrial planets, being primarily composed of rock and metal.

references.text: Chaisson, Eric; McMillan, Steve (2016). Astronomy: A Beginner's Guide to the Universe. Pearson.
